page.title: 12SPOONER ROW STATION
page.content: A group of us visited the station and saw lots of interesting things. While we were there the shift changed. Three people work in the signal box, one lady and two men, who take it in turns to be on duty. The lady has worked for British Rail for one year and one of the men has worked for 35 years for BR. Each shift lasts for 9 hours 45 mins. During the day 39 trains go through each weekday, with fewer trains at weekends. They go to Cambridge, Peterborough, Norwich, London, Ely and Birmingham. Only 12 of these trains stop at Spooner Row station each day, as only a few people get on and off there. The signal box is made of wood with a brick base and is about 90 years old. Inside there are two telephones and a fire extinguisher. There are 15 levers (only 7 work) and two gate locks.
